snippet: Gov. Andrew Cuomo vowed an end to gerrymandering. Now he must keep his promise and veto the Legislature’s self-serving maps.
abstract: Editorial urges New York Gov Andrew Cuomo to veto the Legislature's proposed redistricting maps and to reject deal that will reportedly be offered by Assembly and Senate leaders that they will improve the way the state draws election districts in 2022; says legislators cannot be trusted to draw their own districts and calls for the courts to intervene as they have for drawing Congressional districts.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew Cuomo vowed an end to gerrymandering. Now he must keep his promise and veto the Legislature’s self-serving maps.
